definition: to resume a post
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
to repeat/to double/to overlap/complex (not simple)/compound/composite/double/diplo-/duplicate/overlapping/to duplicate
variant of 復|复[fu4]/to reply to a letter
office/duty

sentences.chinese: 然而，薛潘却不能将杰克复职。

sentences.english: Master Tholme accompanied Vos, to keep an eye on him and judge his performance and rehabilitation.
sentences.chinese: 索尔姆大师与他同行，观察他复职后的表现。

sentences.english: The president reinstated him, so the prime minister has now resigned.
sentences.chinese: 总统却又将其复职，导致总理达哈愤而辞职。

definition: restored to one's official post/to send sb back to his former post
to be transferred to another post/to post away
to ask sb to resign from a post
to resign from office/to dismiss from office
to grant a special pardon
to keep an official position/to hold on to one's job
to return to the capital
to sack/to remove from a position/to depose
to relieve sb of his post/to sack/to demote/dismissal/sacking
to remove sb from their post/to dismiss
to demote (to a lower rank)
to redress (an injustice)/to rehabilitate (sb whose reputation was unjustly sullied)
to leave office
to eliminate/to sack/to remove from office
to retire from a government post (old)
to be released from prison
